Migrating to a Mobile Workstation

While I was travelling, the Dell XPS 13 9310 was perfect, powerful, light, 4K OLED, 512G SSD, 11th Gen Core i7 tiny powerhouse! But now most of my ‚Äútravelling‚Äù has stopped for the most part now - but I‚Äôm still homeless and most likely looking to be for atleast a few months, until we can secure a new house to move into, I need something just a bit ‚Ä¶ bigger. Something just as powerful, with a graphics card, must have 4K and preferably 15 inches up!

So I was taking a look around and spotted a Dell Precision 5530 from NZ PC Clearance, then spotted the next version up, the 5540 edition. Still based off the XPS15 design but its more commercial professional counterpart.

I do love this XPS 13 - I‚Äôm definitely going to keep this unit! But I need to rock me some games and living out on this XPS13 is going to cause issues, it‚Äôs a great laptop to travel with, but for me - it‚Äôs not the workstation/desktop replacement that I need for the daily.

Now I opted for the 5540 at $1,699, but you can get the 5530 which is a generation back with 8th Gen Intel, Pascal instead Turing-era Quadro for $300 cheaper at $1,399. Now if you if you‚Äôre wondering why I didn‚Äôt get the Dell G15 Gaming 5510 - two reasons, I don‚Äôt need a gaming laptop specifically for gaming - just enough to rock the games I want, but I‚Äôve also become a 4K display snob. üòÅ

So ignoring my desktop and 4K panel in storage, which have to wait until I get a house, I have;
